resources.string: Flashlight sends SOS in Morse code
Flashlight flickers going on/off the network
Flashlight flickers on reaching altitude threshold
Flashlight flickers on reaching battery power threshold
Flashlight flickers on reaching timer threshold
You can set a specific height in meters (m) for which you want to get notified by flashlight flickering.
Feature is enabled and currently running. Click to disable it.
Set exactly after how much time you want to get notified by flashlight flickering.
Feature is enabled and currently running. Click to disable it.
Time specified is reached and flashlight is now flickering. The latter shall stop after 15 seconds by default.
Phone\'s battery power shall be monitored at the level you \'ve specified. If that level is reached you will get notified by flashlight flickering.
Feature is enabled and currently running. Click to disable it.

By enabling this feature you will get notified by flashlight flickering when an incoming Call reaches your phone.

Flickering and feature will stop (and button will return to it's initial state) if you answer or reject the incoming Call, or automatically after 15 seconds.

Note that the default flickering time of 15s can be configured in the Settings view.

 When Feature is enabled (green bright button) you can click to disable it.The same holds for all activated features' buttons.
Feature is enabled and currently running. Click to disable it.
Click and you will get notified by flashlight flickering on an incoming SMS. Flickering shall stop after 15 seconds by default.
Feature is enabled and currently running. Click to disable it.
SOS message in Morse code will be transmitted continuously from your flashlight.
SOS message is currently transmitted. Click to disable it.
You can switch on and off the flashlight by producing short sounds, e.g. by finger snapping.
Feature is enabled and currently running. Click to disable it.
You can switch on and off the flashlight by tilting the phone at 90 degrees angles (from its standpoint).
Feature is enabled and currently running. Click to disable it.

Based on your current phone\'s connection status (i.e. in or out of Network/Data/WiFi), you \'ll get notified by flashlight flickering when a) Network signal, Data or WiFi are found again, b) Network signal, Data or WiFi are lost.
Feature is enabled and currently running. Click to disable it.
Network signal, Data or WiFi are been found!
Network signal, Data or WiFi has been lost.
Flashlight will be flickering at the frequency (in Hz) you specify. By default frequency ranges from 1 to 10Hz.
Feature is enabled and currently running. Click to disable it.The same holds for all activated features\' buttons.
Your review will be posted to the Google Play store
Care to share more about it?
Personalize Features specs below\naccording to the defined Ranges.
Flickering time on Battery level reached
Flickering time on Altitude height reached
You may find below full description\nof each button\'s functionality and usage.
Flickering time after an incoming Call:\nRange from 3s to 180s (default 15s)
Flickering on Network/Data found or lost
Click to turn On and Off the phone\'s flashlight.\n\nPress+Hold and Release the button to turn the flashlight On and Off as well.
